I have yet to be treated as anything close to a "customer" in this restaurant. Its like the owners know they will have business whether they treat people well or not, so they go out of their way to AVOID doing anything that would make the experience better.

My arbitrary food score: 3.5. It doesn't suck, and I can eat a ton of it
Experience score: 1. It actually does suck.

Also, they tack a 10% convenience fee on takeout orders. Even when they take twice as long as they quote to prepare the order. This is not something they advertise or mention prior to pickup, and is - in my opinion - silly since I would never tip less than 10% to anyone providing decent service. Oh, wait...now I get it.

This has to be hand's, feet, toes, and whatever other body part you want to use to describe how amazingly AWESOME this place is. I have been doing some major grindage at this establishment since 2004. I have always had an enjoyable experience and meal every time:)

The saki is always a necessity and well with that comes the beer! 

This is a place that even the "I don't like sushi" type can go to and not complain that there is nothing on the menu to eat. Very nice non-sushi selection.
For the sushi lovers and the courageous foodies........NOM NOM's galore. The selection and price are just to "YAY" about and for the times you are so sushi craved the all you can or care to eat lunch buffet ($10.10) is the OMG. I can sit from 11:30am-2:30pm and never eat the same piece twice or thrice unless I want to. They keep the rolls a flowing and change the types every time a new plate goes out. Also get a whole hot bar section as well with calamari, chicken wings, salads, soup, Chinese selections, and dessert. 

Great for the intimate date, party group, or even the solo diner. You are always welcomed with a yell by the whole crew:)

Love the NOMMMA-CHAN!!!

:d

As a starving artist I am dedicating this review to the Ru San's lunch buffet!  I will often skip dinner, and breakfast in preparation for this glorious buffet.  For around $10 you can FILL UP on all you can eat sushi rolls.  You also have the option to have hot food, salad and soup.  I often arrive right at 11:30 opening to miss the line that forms at the door.  The line moves fast and I take it as a positive sign that I am not the only one obsessed with a sushi lunch buffet.  The selection of sushi is good if you like small, more common rolls.  If you are looking for the fancy "American" sushi then you will need to order off the menu.  How can we convince them to carry this buffet through dinner?  I would be there every night!

Who knew North Carolina could have awesome sushi??

The white tuna here is really FRESH!  My friends & I got a plate full of it... literally.

We also got what looked like a tuna martini (forgot the actual name of it) and it had 3-4 types of tuna on skewers in a big martini glass. Very nice!  Two of my favorites were seared tuna & sesame encrusted tuna.

I also ate this sushi with three eggs: quail, tobiko & tamago.  I wanted to spit it out.

I don't think this place is meant to be super fancy; it was a hole-in-the-wall feel but it's still pretty good for it's price.

Ru Sans never disappoints. Every time we have an opportunity to drive up 77 for the sushi buffet we take it. There is always a wonderful variety of sushi rolls that can satisfy any taste. There is also a great selection of shashimi.  For the folks who do not like sushi RuSans offers a hot bar filled with miso soup, egg rolls, fried rice etc.  if you're within 60 miles of this restaurant I promise it is worth the gas. The buffet is $11.99.

Anything better than a sushi buffet? This place is awesome! I definitely can't get enough of it! Lots of my favorite rolls and sashimi too. Restaurant is very clean and got nice decorating. Costumers are most of office people at lunch time. They open at 11am. Me and my friends were waiting 20mins outside when we came first time. By the way the open, just a lot people come from no where all come in same time and restaurant get crowded quickly. Buffers absolutely satisfied our tummies! Yummy! I love octopus sushi and sashimi. And prices are not expensive at all ! Just $13 for each, I got surprised so much because each time I go to sushi bar, it often cost me about $25 for each person. But their sushi are great! Not bad at all ! I definitely will come back with more friends!

Whether you're trying sushi for the first time, or you've got a passion, this place satisfies all of the above. Complex, fun, raw fish rolls, Cali rolls and a small Buffett of hot food and soup. Great place for a lunch date and definitely a place I will return, time and time again. They have a lot of local beers too!!! Woo!

Ru San's has a lively ambience. Our waitress was very attentive and quick. My coworker and I dined here without prior research and we realized after we got our food why they call themselves 'innovative sushi'.

Half of the soft shell crab appetizer were fried vegetable chunks that shape like crabs. One of the sushi roll served was fried. Plum saki tasted like cherry flavored cough syrup.

If you enjoy fried dishes inspired by Japanese cuisine in large portions, this is the place for you.

Favorite neighborhood sushi restaurant.  Has great sushi and a lot of options for non sushi eaters!  My favorite roll is Kiss of Fire.  Good appetizer is the Hawaiian poke.  The ginger salad dressing is the best in town!
This is absolutely the spot to go for sushi in Charlotte!!! There is none better and let me tell you the saki bombs are the business!! I would eat a fart to get to eat here just saying!!!!
Best sushi in charlotte. Fresh food & great presentation. The flavored saki is great too

Love this place. My company comes here a lot for lunch. The sushi buffet I heard it's great although I've never had it but my coworkers love it. Are usually order the green turtle which is super tasty.

Since moving to Charlotte, we've been trying to find a regular sushi restaurant. Since we've been to Ru Sans, we can't bring ourselves to go anywhere else. Amazing sushi and good service. They do not take reservations so be prepared to wait on a Friday or Saturday night. It's always worth the wait!

Sssssuuuuussshhhhi! All I can say is YUM! I was pleasantly surprised to find this sushi bar in Charlotte before heading to a concert that is in the area. My mom and I went to Ru San's around dinner time (6ish) on a Tuesday night and it was pretty busy for a week night. There is nice outdoor seating along with indoor seating and great sushi bar seating. The employees were very friendly and were very helpful when I had any questions about the menu. I ordered a garden salad for my appetizer and my mom ordered the Sea Breeze app. I believe her's was saut√©ed conch meat and spinach. Whatever it was, she loved it! My salad was a nice start to our main entrees. Together we split the chirashi bowl, the rainbow roll, and the firecracker roll. The chirashi bowl was by far my favorite. The sashimi was insanely fresh and I was surprised to find a couple pieces of sweet tofu. Ahhh, and the hype is true! The firecracker roll is DELICIOUS. If you haven't tried it, do yourself a favor and order it ASAP. Lastly, the rainbow roll, a favorite of mine, was very tasty. Nothing special, but very enjoyable. I really enjoyed my experience at Ru San's and I can't wait to make another trip to Charlotte so that I can have another delicious chirashi bowl! They have a huge variety of speciality rolls so I am also interested in trying some of those. My only compliant about Ru San's was that it did not seem like a very professional restaurant. Some of the employees were joking around and talking to each other across tables. Not that that is a huge problem, however, the quality of food was so high that I expected better from the staff. With that being said, I still highly recommend visiting this establishment!

Tasty fresh sushi!

Cheap Sake!

Part of the Regional Chain the southeast...not the best sushi, not the best sake, but it balances price/value and all locations play good dance music later in the night...some with DJ....also know for a really cheap like under $10 AYCE lunch buffet in most locations....

Staple of any travel diet or el cheapo loco local...oops, did I call myself out?

If you're looking to dine in a high-energy environment, go to Ru San's, where the chefs are often yelling and greeting you when you walk in. Ru San's has good sushi and Japanese food. Plus, it's pretty affordable. I'm not a sushi fan, so I tend to get vegetable tempura or teriyaki chicken, both of which are delicious at Ru San's. My sushi-loving friends love the place too.

Visited Ru San's for the first time on Friday evening.  I called ahead to set up a table for 8 people.  We had fantastic service from Eric.  We ordered the yakitori as an appetizer:  Conch, Sea Bass, Mushrooms.  The yakitori was covered in too much sauce and didn't taste grilled like the kind we ate in Japan.  Next, we ordered the Super Protein Sushi Platter to split.  It was a great value and delicious.  The Saketinis were tasty, but not very strong.  I enjoyed my experience there and look forward to visiting again.

Ru San's is my default, dependable sushi spot in town. Their prices are good and the quality is consistent. I like their power builder plates. It's easily enough for two people to share. Ru San's won't knock your socks off but you'll leave happy every time. Avoid coming during peak times because the wait can get scary long.

We came here last weekend and this place was great. They don't take reservations but even after seeing the long line we were still able to sit within a reasonable time frame. The staff were really good and helpful when it came to ordering our food too. Once we got our food, it was amazing. My favorite was the Twice Cooked Smoked Salmon Maki rolls. The sauce on top did it for me. 

Overall, it a great place for sushi lovers!

Very good sushi! I mean it was so fresh and good I can't wait to go back! Downside you have to wait until your entire party is there to be seated but that's fine because it's not the biggest restaurant. Our waitress was friendly and knowledgeable. Huge menu with plenty of options even things for people who don't care for sushi. The food was very nicely plated and a nice sociable atmosphere. I would recommend this spot to anyone who loves sushi!

We've been coming to Ru San's for many years now, and it's always a good time. The service is usually pleasant, and quick. And the sushi and rolls are always very delicious. Nothing fancy. Consistently good. Shout out to Dee who was our delightful waitress last night.

I am always a fan of some Ru San's. Unfortunately at least most of the time the service is horrible. There are 2 waiters that are just awful. They are slow, they never refill your glass...its just bad. 

The food on the other hand is great! I love their $1.50 sushi. It has a fun atmosphere and room for larger parties in the back. But if you do have a large party.. sometimes it may mean you'll be waiting for an hour for food. At least thats my experience with 2 birthday celebrations there. 

If the service was quicker I'd give this place five stars, but that poor service kills it.

Very good lunch buffet!  Price seems to have gone up lately which may push it out of my frequency.....Kenneth.....wish they would put names on the buffet so you know what you are eating.....or maybe we don't want to know what you're eating....I would recommend!

This sushi place had so many options. With over eight pages of options, you can get whatever you wish for. The place was so so crowded, but the service was incredible. Our food came out so quickly and our waiter was so kind despite the busyness. I really enjoyed this place because of the affordability, ambience, and amazing sushi variety!!

Probably the most overrated restaurant in Charlotte.  I give them two stars only b/c of their lunch buffet.  If you are looking to put down an embarrassing amount of mediocre mystery fish rolls- then this buffet is for you.  However, I have never left after the buffet without regretting the decision to eat there in the first place.  The regular menu is huge and has a great variety; but the quality is just not there and to me a lot of bad items does not equal a good meal.  So many other Sushi/Asian restaurants in the area- I would recommend skipping this one.

First visit; came for lunch.  First thing I noticed was the strong scent of industrial cleaner masking fish odor.  I grabbed a plate for the buffet.  None of the items were labeled, so trying to find something I'd enjoy was complete guesswork.  After one bite of what I thought was a noodle turned out to be (I think) eel, I tossed the buffet and ordered some fried rice from the menu.  Wasn't inedible, but still burnt and greasy.

I wanted to give more stars here because there wasn't anything seriously wrong with it, but I couldn't think of any two-star-worthy positives.

This is a hard pass for me.  After eating lunch there I find their sanitation seriously questionable. Eat here at your own risk.  

 I have worked at some very fine high end sushi establishments in my time and even those places tend to cut corners (behind the scenes) so every time I eat at a new sushi establishment I keep my eyes open for red flags.  While dining at Ru San's during lunch I happen to catch quite a few gross warning signs and therefore I will not be coming back here under any circumstance. Which is sad because I was super excited about an all you can eat sushi lunch and was even willing to treck the 40 minutes out of my way on the regular if this place lived up to the hype.  

First of all as of March 2018 they had a Sanitation score of 91 which is already pretty low for my standards.  They also had servesafe certificates hung alongside.  Typically  servesafe certificates add points to a score so that means that they actually have a high 80s score.  Thats some B grade sushi bs that I don't want to mess with.

2ndly their buffet while impressive at 1st glance was a huge disappointment.  NOTHING IS LABELED! This seems dangerous for people with allergies and illegal but obviously probably not but still you would think they would want to cover their asses and label their seafood products. You only have your eyes to discern what you are actually eating and putting in your body.  However all the rolls seemed to be the same 3 ingredients (tuna, avocado, crab) just mixed around abit.  Every single fried roll they put out wasnt even remotely warm by the time it got onto the buffet.  As I eagerly waited for a fresh plate of fried sushi rolls to come out to the buffet it was clear that they still had been made at least 20 minutes prior to them coming out to the buffet.

And lastly the mother of all red flags happened at the end of our meal.  Our server truly did something so unspeakable and so appalling that I was flabbergasted by it for a few days.  My friend and I had finished our meal but we were still sitting around chatting because it was my birthday and we drove 40 minutes to get here so we were in no rush to leave.  There were still at least 5 tables sitting around us that were still eating. Everything down to our straw wrappers and soy sauce had been prebussed at this point and we only had our waters left in front of us.  I was planning on drinking my water down b4 we left so I would be hydrated for my trip back.  Then it happened.  Our server came over and STUCK HER FINGERS IN MY WATER to pick them up and THEN looks at me and asks me if I was done drinking it.  Well my jaw dropped open and obviously yeah after someone sticks their hands in your drink I'd say I'm done.

 Not only was this experience utterly disappointing but it also gave me the bad poops so yeah I am definietly not coming back to this nasty facility they call a sushi restaurant.

Delicious sushi. I'm sure they have something for everyone on the menu. I've visited Ru San's multiple times and it is delicious every time. The drinks are priced extremely well for a restaurant in Charlotte. The atmosphere is also great. Only con would be the back area of the restaurant and the restrooms could use a little TLC.

You guys, you are not a true sushi lover if you haven't been to Ru Sans.

The sushi here is to die for, so amazing. The service is quick and the staff is so friendly.

They make really cool sushi rolls that you can find anywhere else. The fish is fresh and full of flavor. This place is honestly the most price friendly place to get sushi at in Charlotte without it lacking anything but greatness.
Best damn sushi buffet I've ever had, hands down. Get there early or you'll be waiting out the door for a table.

Meh...kind of feel steered wrong by my fellow yelpers. Overall, just "meh". 

I have seldom met a spider roll I didn't like so when I saw the Angry Crab Roll my insides got all gooey with excitement only to be served overly greasy, soggy crab without any crunch AND it was topped with fake crab AND it had romaine lettuce sticking out like a salad. 

Overall, just kind of sad knowing how amazing this roll could have been and the kind of place that makes me upset I did my hair for this.

The one nice thing, and reason it has 2 stars instead of 1 is because my server, Mauro, was very helpful, friendly, and efficient.

Really, all the staff is very friendly, they deserve better.
Love this place!  GIANT selection of specialty rolls and I can't get to try something new every time.  I've never been disappointed.  Wonderful, wonderful lunch buffet too.

I've been to Ru Sans a few times, and I've always left stuffed. Although I don't eat fish, Ru Sans has a variety of vegetarian sushi options. The prices on their rolls are excellent, and the food is always great. 

It's a little tight inside, but I went with a big group and we still were able to get seated. It wasn't ideal, but it was good enough. I've been in with a kid as well, and the staff was friendly with him and helped the mother get him situated and fed. 

Overall, it's earned its reputation as one of the best sushi spots in Charlotte. It's not pretentious, the food is good, the service is friendly, and the prices are great.

The look/atmosphere is nothing to write home about.  But if you want to go somewhere that you can get full on sushi for $10-$15, this is your place.  The lunch buffet is the best.  All you can eat sushi buffet for approximately $10.  They have 20ish different types of sushi on the bar and they are so good.  My only complaint is that they aren't labeled, so you don't really know what you're eating.  When you go for dinner, they have a huge sushi menu with several rolls under $5.

Decent sushi for a decent price. Huge selection of rolls, I had some decision issues when the waiter finally came around. I'm usually good with choosing rolls I want, but after 2 beers and 2 sake bombs, I was having issues with everything. Quality of sushi wasn't the worst I've had in CLT, but def not the best either. Space was large and well lit. Atmosphere was lively with the sushi chefs shouting greetings at everyone and cheering on any would be sake bomb drinkers. TVs are aplenty, which is nice if you want to watch a game whilst eating your face off. And parking is ample. The Ru San's in the Buckhead neighborhood of Atlanta is better and has more selection, but the chefs share the same enthusiasm. I'll have to come back for $10 sushi buffet.

I love this place.  The lunch buffet is amazing (especially considering it's less than $11 per person). They have a good variety of different rolls and Chinese food on the lunch buffet.  For the dinner menu they also have extensive options, and a specials sheet that changes seasonally (which is really nice).  While the dinner menu is obviously pricier than the lunch menu it is still reasonable.  I recommend trying this place out, if for nothing else, for the lunch buffet!

I've been eating Ru Sans since 95' in Atlanta, solid and great food!
  Either the lunch buffet or a delicious dinner, I am never disappointed.

You have to experience this place to understand my facinstion. Whether it's a custom order or served on their incredible lunch buffet THIS is Sushi at it's best. May I suggest " Gone with the wind". An absolute work of art! One of the most impressive works of edible art. There may be a foolish moment when it arrives at your table you consider sharing. Don't.

Came in today and had the rudest most unpleasant dining experience i have had in a long time. This was the worst customer service I have had all year long and tasted worse than many of Charlotte's other sushi selection.what can you expect when u get to pick sushi pieces off a dollar menu, let me know next time ill hit McDonald's.... First off my meal arrived 10 minutes prior to my friend's meal, they had forgotten it, I completely finished my food before they brought my friends meal. The sushi, I would say tastes like the per made at Harris teeter, oops I meant food lion. It fell apart as I was trying to grab half of it and I had not gotten the spicy aioli I ordered out on top of everything as I asked...

   Meanwhile the waitress was running around doing lord knows what and seemed to want to have nothing to do with us, she was a tall older caucasian lady. Never once was I asked how's my food, which it was bad and wrong. It honestly seemed that the bus boy was getting us drinks and was communicating with our server for us. Ridiculous. 

After my friend finishes eating, we sit talking for ten minutes hoping to get our check and the waitress has now been gone for over twenty minutes...I had to ask a random server to get our check and bring it to us.  our waitress comes up drops the bills off and leaves not even bothering to communicate what it was she had disappeared for or apologize for us having to ask Someone else to do her work.
 
On top of all the terrible service and disgusting food received so far.. She added a beer to the wrong check and completely messes up the bill. To our luck the manager walks up. I try and tell her a mistake was made but the lady speaks next to Zero English. It was like talking to the Great Wall of China. And to my surprise it looks like the lady is getting angrier as i tell her they have made a mistake it was like talking to my 8 year old nephew. As I'm in the middle of trying to explain to her she rudely Snatches the bill and my money out of my hand and walks away after telling me that I am cursing at her which I am not at all. On top of all this TErrible service. They then bring me the wrong amount of change, short a few dollars. Brought by some short fat girl with a buzz covered in tattoos, wierd. She then proceeds to tell us that we should not be rude to the owner of the place and if we do not like the food we should not come back. expecting an apology from the staff, me and my friend were obviously shocked at the lack of care and disrespect this establishment shows to its patrons. I threw the remaining cents in my pocket on the table in disgust, only as a bitter reminder of her atrocity to waitressing and the management in general at Rusan's.

This was my third time here and i will never be returning. I live in the neighborhood and am glad to say they have lost my business and i hope yours too if you read this.This place was a HORROR SHOW.

8.50 sushi buffet, your expectations can't be that high.

But! The sushi is actually pretty good, and they even have sashimi. You can tell not all the sushi/sashimi's not fresh, but I guess that's why it's 8.50. 

Place is pretty crowded but kept clean for the most part!

I've frequented this place more than several times and for several years, tonight the service was the worst. I understand everyone has to start from somewhere but the server had no business working on the floor and it's a slow Monday night. He should have been trained better before hitting the floor. What should have been a 45 minute dinner tops, turned into a 90 minute dinner. Quite disappointing!

1. My family and I love sushi!!! We have wanted to try Ru Sans for quite some time now. Tonight did not disappoint!!!

2. Appetizers of pork potstickers and beef yakitori.....delicious!

3. Sushi rolls...shrimp tempura maki, crunchy mui beno, red devil, and dragon fly....all freaking awesome!!!! Absolutely delicious!!!!

4. Service was excellent!!!! Nothing fancy, just great food!!!!!

Ditto Annie - decent sushi for a decent price.  Service is quick and the place is always jammed at lunch.  I love the unlimited buffet but could you please label the plates so I know what I am picking up?  I am not too picky but geez some of it you dont want to waste the stomach space on.  I will definitely be back but I will also keep an eye on your sanitation rating Ru Sans!  Dont let me down again!!

i ate there a few weeks ago for some take out sushi. i ordered two sushi rolls and the total came out to over twenty dollars!!! i was like, "how is that possible the rolls were only $7.50 a piece?" the waiter then said they charge a 10% gratuity for all take out orders. i'm like how unfair is that? who adds a mandatory 10%, to your bill, especially when a waiter or waitress didn't even serve you food? am i paying a 10% gratuity for the fact the fact that you put my food in a box? i have never heard of such a thing..  smh ?

Again food was ok.
Now talk about getting take out
not eating at the restaurant calling up for an order to go..

This us the only place that adds a tip to your take out bill.
THAT IS TOTALLY WRONG!!!!

Originally tried this restaurant in Atlanta and really enjoyed. Was very happy to see that they have a Charlotte location. I accidentally ordered the wrong roll, but my server was kind enough to let me order something else that I would like more. Overall good experience and great food!

For what Ru San's is--a cheap place to get decent sushi--it excels. It offers a very happy medium between fancy (and pricey) sushi with impeccable presentations and the stale and often sketchy "to-go" sushi you find in grocery stores. 

Here you can find quick service and tasty rolls that won't break the bank. Against all odds, the menu ordered by price (e.g., $1+, $1.5+, $2+) is not only convenient but are of much higher quality that you would expect. As not a huge fan of fish, I was rather excited to see a very palatable and extensive veggie section. It is nice to have options beyond "the veggie roll" and indeed the Veggie Futo Maki legitimately rocked my world.

I will say that the lunch buffet--even at the ridiculously price of like $10 for all you can eat sushi, fried noodles, chicken wings, miso soup, and some other classics--was somewhat of a let down. The rolls are mostly rice, often fried, and contain cream cheese. While all of these are a few of my favorite things (along with whiskers on kittens and raindrops on roses), it makes the meal a bit too heavy for having sushi. Plus, there were no veggie options. Overall the buffet does not do Ru San's justice, so I recommend ordering from the menu.

Finally, it can be a bit cold in there, at least during the summers. Do consider bringing a light sweater.
A Charlotte Sushi institution!  Lunch buffet is awesome, fresh, and delicious, and the chocolate mousse cake and strawberry cake are to die for!

Hello, buffet (delicious) sushi! I frequent this place about once every 2 weeks or so. You can sit at a table (if available) or at the bar where you can watch the sushi being made in front of you. They have hot items, salads and desserts on one bar and all kinds of sushi rolls on another. They are constantly re-stocking the bars with fresh rolls and there is always a great variety. Best of all-because it's a buffet-it's super fast! I know I can get in and get out and get a good meal in the process.

**As of November 1st they no longer allow buffet takeout... in case you were looking forward to doing so...**

Best lunch buffet deal- all you can eat Sushi!  Now that I live in California, I can't believe I didn't take more advantage of that option.  Interesting rolls and fresh sushi.  Always busy and pretty loud, very fun!

They have decent price for sushi. But OMG workers there can be so rude! If you plan on calling for Togo orders or to speak to someone during dinner time, THINK AGAIN! They will literally pick up the phone and hang up on you! Thats just RUDE!

Great place to have sushi and saki! This place is big. It can handle big groups as well. I tried a couple of the special appetizers. I was not thrilled with the fried zucchini and jalape√±o poppers but they were not bad. The sushi roll I had was awesome. The place does get busy. The only thing I would mention was that towards the end, we couldn't get our bill. We were ready to pay and get going but because it was super busy, it took a while to get our bill. I had to stand up for a while because I was tired of sitting down.

I'm not sure why this place has 3 1/2 stars. This is by far the best sushi place in Charlotte and totally normal prices. I'm a bit of a sushi snob and can't eat it anywhere. So with that I give this place 5 stars!!

Arrived in Charlotte and were eating here within the hour since our daughter said this was the best sushi. Since we were just back from Japan, it was good but not Japan worthy. I did like the huge number of selections available but the service is a bit on the slow side. The pork belly fried rice was good but not worth it and some of the rolls were good. I was most impressed by the Sea waves since the mussels were good and the spinach with it was excellent. The tuna tatami was nothing special at all- wish I could get my money back for this dish.

Good value.  Only one small section of Salmon Nigiri (no other kinds) on the buffet and lots of different rolls. 

If you I have never been here let me tell you how it works. Get here at 11:15am, before they open, and you will stand in line to get in.  That is not a worry though, because there are plenty of tables and seats at the bars. I will tell you this place is a MADHOUSE!!!  When I left there were people standing in line out the door.

For the lunch buffet I was in an out in 30 minutes.

The sushi quality is good but it is a buffet so you're not going to get top of the line.  There are two Buffet tables set up... one has a nice variety of rolls, and the other has a few traditional Japanese Buffet items....with one small section of salmon nigiri.

Service was very friendly and very fast.  Neat experience to be somewhere this busy, and the quality of sushi is decent.

 But I've had better.

I've been here a few times. Both of my sisters absolutely love this place, so they suggest it all the time. I'm a huge fan of sushi, but I don't get the appeal of this restaurant so far. 

I think their sushi is decent, but not amazing. Maybe because I usually do the sushi buffet, so it's made in mass quantities and has been sitting out for a little while. (If I go again, I'll try ordering something off the actual menu and write an updated review.) It's also confusing because the buffet food isn't clearly labeled! I love trying different types of sushi, so I don't mind this. But it'd be nice to know the names of each so I could get more of the ones I enjoyed.

The presentation/environment of the restaurant is not great either. It's squished and crowded. It also seems a bit dirty.

I've never had a problem with their service, though! Their wait staff is extremely friendly and helpful.

This could have been a five star review if it was only relative to the food.  But I bumped it down just because of the no frills type place it is and the fact it can be extremely loud with all the sushi chefs constantly yelling or it's more like war cries but whatever.  I walked in there today and one of them started giving me a power clap style ovation....meh....my kind of guy so I obliged with my own clapping right back!  All in good fun :)

Ok, so no other place in Charlotte does a sushi buffet like this joint.  If you are hungry you can't find a better deal, it's something like $10, for all you can eat.  You could easily spend that on just 2 rolls anywhere else.  The sushi here is kind of "Americanized" in my opinion.  I'm not complaining but seriously, just know that if you eat sushi that has been deep fried, um, that's not healthy.  

They keep time labels on the sushi plates so as to make sure the sushi is the freshest it can be but normally the sushi runs out before the time does, so that should tell you something!  It's really good.  

I will continue to keep Ru San's in my Ru-tation for great local sushi spots! :)

Note: It can get crowded so I suggest getting there as close to 11:30 for lunch, otherwise you may have to wait (even though probably not long).

Love their sushi selection! Always fresh and delicious too...always ordering too much and stuffing myself. Have a great selection of non-sushi items as well. The ambiance is great. Order a saki-bomb and see what happens! The place comes alive!

I'm a huge fan of sushi period.  But I'm even more of a fan of sushi that's fresh, flavorful, and CHEAP!  I know it sounds crazy, but the $5.95 Philly Roll was mind-blowing.  Ha-ha.  Definitely, try it.  The nigri was delicious and while it may sound insane, they have the best miso soup I've ever had-in my life.  A simple thing, but so good for the soul.  :)  I would say that anyone who hasn't been-must go....like NOW.  What are you waiting for?
We are here at least once a year a celebration and it has never failed to please. We try at least one new dish and have only found more good stuff!

I love ru san's.

Amazing. Amazing. Amazing. 

I know that they have a lunch buffet that they have during the week and saturday for just $10. I have never had it because I'm allergic to shellfish and vegetarian, but my friends seem to love it. 

The cream cheese tempura roll and it is to die for.

If you're looking for a fun atmosphere paired with awesome Japanese food then you can't go wrong with Ru San. I have been coming to Ru San's since I moved to Charlotte about 7 years ago. Sushi, awesome service, sake-bombs, hip environment... yeah it's hard not to like this place.

I highly, HIGHLY recommend this place if you're craving Japanese food. The prices were very reasonable for a nice dinner (less than $50 for two people AFTER a 20% tip.) Service and food were both excellent.
This place is the BEST sushi restaurant ever! Service is great and their sashimi is beyond words especially the Napoleon sashimi! Loveeee this place!! Service is always great here.

In Charlotte, this is by far the best sushi I have had! Matter of fact I can't think of too many places I've been that is just all around the bomb.  First off, I love how cheap the maki rolls are, but they maintain the quality.  Their specialty rolls are the bomb!!!  Don't feel limited to what is on the menu. If you see something you like you can modify, but be careful it can get pricy when you start building your own.  We usually come for the buffet every Saturday, and when my fiance is off during the week.  We've been for dinner as well.  I prefer their regular menu, just because I can get what I want, but I love the buffet because I can have the best of everything!  I just love this place and can't get enough of it!  If we ever leave Charlotte, Ru Sans will be the standard for every sushi place I try.  As a matter of fact it already is!

Big fan of Ru Sans. Always try to hit this place when in Downtown Charlotte.

Fish is prepared well, huge menu, great prices.

Not much more to say - I will go back again and again.
Love eating here! The sushi is alway great and the staff is very friendly! Definitely worth checking out if you haven't already.

As someone who cannot eat fish, I always expect just okay noodles when going out for sushi with my boyfriend. Ru Sans has a HUGE menu - it is mostly sushi which I don't enjoy, but I was still impressed that they were even able to offer so many things. I don't remember exactly what it was called, but I had spicy udon noodles with vegetables - they were indeed very spicy! I love spicy food, and these almost seemed too spicy, but yet I could not stop eating them. So delicious! The fried rice has an almost smokey flavor to it (my boyfriend says its from authentic use of a wok), and both entrees left us with a bill under $30 for dinner. Not bad! The entire staff was very friendly; the guys rolling sushi on the line said hello and goodbye to us, and thanked us for coming in....all six of them at once - it was overwhelming when we came in, but when we left we gathered that it is custom to their culture, which in the end I found to be a bit endearing. Overall, a very friendly, fun place to grab a quick lunch or dinner!

I stop in on every visit to Charlotte
Once a month.  Also a regular at the Atlanta location. Great Sushi every time

I wasn't a big fan. The sushi was ok. I've had so much better. I just wasn't impressed with the quality of sushi. The staff was nice though. I probably won't be returning but everything is always worth a try

Jonathan T. and I might be sharing a brain, because I may have also turned a corner on my love for RuSan's.... the quality is just not there sometimes.

I can't do the lunch buffet any longer - the sloppy rolls, no bueno. Plus it's not $9.95!

Will still go here for dinner though - I think their care and freshness are still A+ after the lunch crowd leaves.

If you're a sushi connoisseur SKIP THE LUNCH! Just go for dinner :)

The price is reasonable for sushi, and the menu has a an unparalleled amount of variety. It's a fun environment and the staff interacts well with the patrons.
My problem is the food. It's just such a poor quality of product. The fish, while fresh enough, has some of the lowest quality of cuts I have ever experienced. Fatty in a bad way, gristle, and poorly sliced.
For example: the dynamite yaki has large pieces of octopi in the bake. Super chewy to the point of being difficult to eat. The baked tuna was an off putting gray color, and the salmon well over cooked.
Agadashi (sp?) tofu is fried and the coating resembles funnel cake batter. The "healthy" seeming nature and intricate flavor of the dish is completely lost on the preparation.
I had several pieces of sashimi that were thickly cut, sinewy, and dry/old.

I won't be back.
Favorite sushi place in Charlotte. They have a great buffet as well. I wish they served fountain sodas (they bring a can) but other than that, they are great!!
I love RuSans! Their sushi, teriyaki rice ball, lunch buffet, ramen, and so much more! If you want great sushi at reasonable prices...do yourself a favor and go!
Bar none, the best sushi in Charlotte! Friendly staff and amazing sushi options. It's very new age sushi with the perfect blend of tradition.

Wow....I have never been here for lunch during the week........and I have never seen nor experienced the buffet......but I did this last Monday.

It was a bank holiday, so I decided to have a little sushi for lunch and headed to Ru San's.  At 2pm in the afternoon I expected this place to be dead....I was dead wrong!

It was packed and I was told about the lunch buffet.  $10 for all you could eat of both sushi and a small hot tray area.

I quality of sushi was "ok" though without names I wasn't sure of about 80% of what I was eating sushi wise.

Wait staff were all over the place, but did get my beers in a timely manner so no issues there.

PROs - I was glad to get my fill of sushi  at a really good price.......

CONs - The mass of people and craziness was not for me.

Still love the place........but without the buffet.
Amazing sushi at a reasonable price. Ultimate tuna, rich and famous, steak roll, kiss of fire, and gladiator rolls are some of our favorites.

If your looking for a great deal on sushi this is the place. There lunch buffet comes with an okay selection of sushi along with noodles, fried calamari, meso soup, and ginger salad. It's a value you just cant find any where else.

The staff is extremely friendly but dont expect to be seated until your entire party has arrived. This is understandable as the place is basically filled from the time they open at 11:30am until lunch ends at 2:30. 

We did some Saki bombs and our waitress was kind enough to bring over some napkins just in case they were needed. Our waters were always full and plates cleared quickly.

Don't expect too much in terms of quality and selection if your going to their buffet. But its still a good value for what you pay. If you are picky about sushi, order what you like off their normal menu and you'll be happier. Their normal prices are very reasonable.

Thrice have I now indulged in the wonderful lunch buffet that is Ru San's.  Each time I've gone, I have loved it more than the last.  For $9.99 at lunch time, you can eat as much of their tasty sushi as you like.  On the buffet, they usually have about 12 or so different types of maki rolls that you can eat.  On the other table, they have sushi, delicious fried calamari, stir-fry, desserts, and other little appetizers and salads, in case you get sick of just eating maki rolls.  They keep rotating out different kinds of rolls throughout the lunch period.  I was surprised on how many different types of rolls they put out.  

Yes, it is pretty much always busy here at lunch time.  Yes, you have to buy individual cans or bottles of drinks (particularly soda and beer).  It can get pretty noisy with all the people, and sometimes it gets a little difficult to get into the buffet lines.  I can never figure out which direction you're supposed to go, which is mildly chaotic.  Even when they first open, there's often a line outside the door waiting to get in.  Sometimes, when it's really busy, you have to wait a few minutes before the servers come so you can pay your tab.  If you don't mind that, this place is delicious, fast, and pretty cheap for a sushi lunch.

That being said, I've never been to dinner, so I can't speak as to that aspect.  At lunch time the servers basically just clear plates, which I've never had a problem with.

Gotta say, Ru San's is the warmest sushi restaurant ever. Everyone is super friendly, from the hostess to the guys behind the counter. And their $5 lunch box is incredible. Buffet style, self serve sushi, plus the chefs will handroll something fresh if you ask nicely. They even have fried chicken wings and stirfry dishes.
The first time I went, the chef was disappointed that I could CLOSE THE LID on my box, and insisted I go back for more. This isn't a place for sushi snobs, but it's an awesome, cheap, filling and friendly experience.

While I am not a Japanese food expert and definitely not a sushi expert by any means, I must say I have pretty high standards for both. For me, this establishment has done something that very, very few have done before. It gave me a feeling of satisfaction with my sushi. To me, sushi is a type of cuisine based around sticky rice that often involves raw fish. I believe it should be painstakingly prepared by masters with simple yet amazing flavor and design.

While I tried to stay away from their original rolls, the traditional sashimi was expertly prepared. The big bowl udon was fantastic and had all of the old-school additions that remind me of home (I'm chinese by the way.) The beef tataki had good flavor and a good grill on the edges with a nice balanced dipping sauce. The sushi and sashimi assortment dinner is a most-try for those who are new to this type of cuisine.

While all of the food hit the right marks for me, let's talk service. Oh man.. service.  It. Was. Crazy. While some restaurants assert a need to keep things clean and customers happy. The staff here insured every glass was always full of your chosen non-alcoholic beverage. They kept every bottle of sauce full as well with even the smallest amount used to be replaced immediately.  If that isn't pedantic service than I don't know what is. The server even poured my first cup of sake, which is extremely respectful in my eyes.

This place would receive a five star but I feel five stars are only for the restaurants that can either change my ideals, give my a cathartic experience or something along those lines. But it this establishment was just about to hit that mark.

Hip, industrial-chic sushi restaurant with oodles of choices on offer. The mood is young, fun-loving, and a little wacky--not at all uptight or pretentious. As my brother, a Charlotte sushi-lover, says, you come to Ru San for the rolls and go elsewhere if you're in the mood for nigiri.

 We absolutely loved the tuna tataki (piles of perfectly seared tuna atop crisp vegetable filaments with a side of pure heaven as a dipping sauce). Other winners included the Olympic Five Ring Roll, served with yet another divine sauce, this time a spicy aioli, and the Firecracker Roll, quite possibly the most delicious roll I've ever had. As another reviewer pointed out, their specialties tend toward the deep-fried and saucy, but that's ok by me. Just add edamame and Asahi for a nutritious, balanced meal. 

Apparently Ru San plummeted in quality when chef and owner Ru left town, but now he's back and has restored the place to its former glory.
Years later and this is still one of my favorite sushi spots in Charlotte. I personally think the sushi here is way better than what you'd get at Pisces. Highly recommend

They have the BEST Chirashi Bowl in town, hands DOWN! Years ago, I would order this and it was only $15 bucks.  No one knew about this and I thought it was such a bargain because it comes in a BIG bowl of full on sashimi with soup or salad. I thought it was my little secret so whenever I come here, I always ordered it since I loved it so much. They are very generous with the type of fish as well.  Then after telling my friends about this or they would see my chirashi order comes out (who also has the SAME love for sashimi like I do), they now all ordered it too.  I guess it gained popularity and attentions from the owners/workers since we would have like a table of 4 orders of just chirashi bowls at least 2x or 3x times in a week.  That's A LOT of sashimi but it was so good!  Maybe Rusan's picked up that this was too much of a bargain and upped their prices to $17.95 (considering other sushi places around town at the time 2-3 yrs ago were overcharging chirashi bowl for $22-$25 for a small dinky bowl of raw fish).  What I thought was a steal now is no longer a steal. :(

I was a little upset they would do this but it's still a good deal in Charlotte whenever I'm craving sashimi so much.  Then last summer, they increased the prices up to $19.95, um what?!  I came back last month and I found out they took the Chirashi bowl off their newly updated menu but I still ordered it.  Finds out they charged it to around $22.95 or something like that now. What a bummer.  I won't be surprised if they kept increasing it to $25. Oh well, it doesn't bothers me now since I don't go there often but looks to me like they don't want many people to order it anymore if they had taken it off the menu.  Although I'm a little upset of the increasing prices, I have to say for the most part the chirashi bowls are always extremely abundant & impressive.  This place always has the best sushi and apps as well.  It's also not that pricey at all and you can get pretty full without spending a lot. 

Service however, sometimes sucks.  They're never known for their service so don't even bother reviewing about it. It's standard.

They have all you can eat sushi on the weekdays during lunch for $12 bucks (I think) so that's a good deal.  Except all the sushi are very basic (cheap to make) with tons of rice outside and very tiny sushi fillings. Yeah, they're trying to fool you in thinking you're eating for cheap, they know it! haha. Good way for them to make money by trying to get rid of their leftovers. (?)
Good was great my tummy is very happy. Staff was slammed so service could be better. Line out the door before it even opened and through our entire meal days something about the quality

I was wowed by this place the second I looked at the menu. Sushi that didn't break the bank but very fresh! We sat at the bar and watched the sushi gods make amazing rolls! I had hot tea but next time will definitely try one of the Sake mixed drinks. I had my eye on the sake pomegranate. I like that it has other options besides Sushi since my husband isn't a fan. He got the noodle dish with beef which was ahhhhmazzzing! We both loved it. They have a lunch buffet on the weekends for less than 12. Which I hope to check out soon. Outdoor patio seating is clutch for the warmer weather! It was decently busy but no wait and food came out quick! Walked out under 40 bucks w. Tip! 2 drinks(non-alcoholic), an appetizer & 2 dinners!

First time at Ru San's and the sushi/sashimi was amazing. They provided a cucumber appetizer upon seating which was a great surprise. I ordered three pieces of yellow tail, two smoked salmon and one piece of scallop sashimi along with their kiss of fire roll. The kiss of fire is mix is tuna and salmon with avocado, topped with sriracha sauce.  Their wait staff are very friendly and welcoming.  I'd give this place ten stars if I could!

Ru San's you disappoint me. Really, really disappoint me. If you know anything about the tradition of sushi, this is the rebellious son of the traditional eats saying "screw you, dad, I'm going to play my loud music and go CRAZY. To hell with your tradition". Ru San's is loud, slow, and the plating/rolls are messy.

My date and I waited a whole hour and a half before our food came. The waiter was really nice and continued to profusely apologize for the chef's terrible pace (and he comped us free salad too), but a good waiter can't make up for a bad place.

They do have loads of veggie maki rolls, which is a plus. We ordered the cranberry roll, sweet potato roll, teriyaki zucchini roll, inari roll, and kimchi roll. The cranberry was messy and the kimchi was a bit... off but aside from that they were okay.

Don't come here if you have somewhere to be after (I did and I ended up missing it). I'd just say "don't come here" in general, but seeing I have yet to find some place better in CLT to go, I guess if you have the time and enjoy loud atmospheres, here's the place for you.
Favorite Sushi in Charlotte! Affordable and great service
Really really good sushi here but kinda pricey. Always really crowded so there's usually a little wait. It's a staple in our sushi diet.

i only go for the chicken fried rice!!!! i'm writing in all caps because it is that crucial to try!! big enough to share!!! delicious enough you won't want to!! you will look at all other fried rice with disappointment after you try ru san's. 

thank me later.

The sushi and the Yakitori were both lacking. The tuna didn't taste fresh and the Yakitori was drowned in sauce to cover up its lack of flavor.  Are there any AUTHENTIC sushi places in this town if so please let me know

Lunch hour Mon-Fri is ALWAYS busy! So be prepared to wait..... Of course the wait is well worth it. Took my sister here for all you can eat sushi. Food was amazing of course. Everything was fresh and made to perfection. Our waitress was very sweet even though she was busy running around.... Left a nice tip of course.

I go about once a week. The sushi is fantastic and you can't beat the lunch buffet price. Friday's at noon is a bad idea though. It's so crowded you can't get in the door and the food gets gobbled up almost as fast as they can put it out. They are usually pretty fast about getting more done though. So final word, avoid Friday lunch, but a must go for lunch any other day.
Went last Saturday night, the first time in a while.  There were 6 of us and we got a big table immediately.  The waitress was very attentive and I was very happy with my meal.  My only compl
Delicious sushi and fun atmosphere! Wait staff is also very friendly  Great place for a fun group of folks.

Ok, I will give this place an honest 3.5 Yet I keep coming back even though I tell myself I wouldn't. Why? because when you get those sushi cravings, there is no other place in Charlotte, or let alone many parts of the US that is like this. Maybe in New York or like San Francisco...but definitely not in Charlotte. The LUNCH BUFFET that everyone else is raving about is the only thing I have tried. You have a good amount of sushi roll selections, raw, fried, vegetarian and sashimi!! I think the sashimi section is what makes it worth it, 4 plates, usually 2 tuna and 2 salmon. They used to just put out raw sashimi slices around a certain time but the past few times I've been, they stopped doing that (the sashimi is stuck to a a rice roll). That was a huuuge bummer. But oh well, I still come back. Their miso soup is terrible, too pasty and not flavorful at all, no tofu or seaweed it in just the soup. Their lo-mein is also really bad, drenched in sesame oil, which is VERY heavy. I LOOVE their fried rice though, it's quite fluffy mixed with diced carrots and peas. Their calamari is also pretty good. 

Also to be fair, I have heard a good amount of sanitation problem with this place, but I think since their last incident a good 5 years or so back, they have really tried to step it up. Never heard about sexual harrassement but I wouldn't be surprised. 

Try to get here early for the lunch buffet otherwise you would have to wait and it is a PAIN!

I like Ru Sans. It's good if you're craving sushi and you want something quick and easy. The vibe in there is very casual. The food is good, but it's far from fancy. They have a good selection of rolls and the prices are reasonable. The waitstaff is also quite good.

The lunch buffet is craaaazy. It's a great value, but it's unlike any sushi buffet I've ever been too. It's pure chaos. But they have a lot of sushi and non-sushi options. If you're willing to put up with the chaos, it's a great deal. 

I tried the ramen there and although it tasted good, it wasn't authentic ramen. If you're used to ramen in NY, SF or DC, don't order it here. But it's not a bad soup. 

I like it here if I want something quick and easy. I'm not blown away, but it's pretty good. Ideally I'd give it 3.5 stars, but I tend to round up. 4 it is.

Best sushi in Charlotte, hands down. Have been here a few times for dinner and finally made it for their lunch and it was amazing. All of the sushi was fresh and they made sure there was plenty available for everyone.

Went today for the sushi buffet and while the food was decent enough for a buffet setting I was not a fan of a few things:
- the sushi rolls were not labeled
- tongs were not available for each plate causing people to use the same tong for multiple plates
- the sushi side of the buffet was kind of a mess when it came to forming a line

I will give it to them, the food was fresh and rotated very often. Each time I went up to the sushi table there was a fresh plate for several of the rolls.

My boyfriend isn't a fan of sushi so he sampled the hot food ... it was pleasant enough but it lacked variety. 

Overall we had a good time, but I don't think we will add this into the rotation until we sample more places to see what's out there.

Friendly staff.

Good Food and lots of choices!  Great prices.

Nice atmosphere with plenty of booth seating, outdoor seating and bar seating with a couple of tv's.
The service is quick for a to go order but the strangest thing happens.  I got charged a service charge. Why is it a service charge for a to go order?
Great sushi lunch buffet!! Love it

Ru Sans is amazing. Always busy, but worth the wait. I try to get a different sushi roll every time I go, which is easy since their sushi menu is huge. Their sashimi is amazing as well. If you like sushi, and you haven't been here, you're missing out big time!

Since I moved to Charlotte I've been looking for an all you can eat sushi lunch special. I loved the one in my college town and I haven't found one like it yet, but this is a pretty close second. I prefer the made to order all you can eat style but this buffet is pretty good! Usually people hear sushi buffet and immediately think yuck I'm gonna get sick but that's not true with this place. Lunch is always busy and the sushi never sits on the buffet longer than 10 minutes, goes like hot cakes. They put out a good variety including specialty rolls and the quality is good. This isn't 5 star gourmet sushi or anything but it's definitely good for the price of 11.95 for lunch. Definitely give it a try, might have to wait for a table and the service is ok,but considering it's a buffet there's not much to do unless your ordering off the menu. I'm excited to try it for dinner sometime!
Amazing place! We go here once a week. Huge menu. Great prices. The staff is very friendly. We are constantly taking new people with us. This is by far our favorite sushi restaurant in Charlotte.

Nostalgia dominates my rating.

This place is still excellent, but the prices have crept up and the service has declined.  Even with this gentle slide it is by far my favorite place to get sushi in the queen city.

The pros are they have one of the more imaginative all you can eat buffets.  They have my favorite dish which includes fried crispy spinach and vinegar.  I got my wife into sushi at this very restaurant.

Cons: loud, loud, loud.  Busy, busy, busy.  It is hard to find a parking spot, it is hard to find a seat, it is hard to hear anything not being shouted at you.

If you want to really revel in food and have some nice drinks: RuSan for the win.

Another cheap sushi buffet place. My friends were all praise abt this place before I  tried it myself. Sushi is below average but worth the buffet price. Filled my hungry stomach but  not satisfied with taste. For three, bill was $29.15 on Saturday lunch buffet, which is cheap.

The only thing you need to know about Ru San's:

All you can eat sushi lunch buffet.

The selection of rolls and sushi is neither varied or exceptional but for $10 you can't go wrong. Ru San's definitely has the best bang for buck sushi in the area hands down!

Maybe I have finally turned the corner and become a sushi snob!  I stopped in here the other day for the lunch buffet and was less than pleased with the quality of food.  I've been here for the buffet in the past but its been awhile.  

I do realize that it's a $10 sushi buffet so expecatations were set accordingly.  The mushy avacado is the rolls was just unacceptable.  The huge bowl of wasabi was just weak at best.  

My suggestion would be to skip the buffet and go get sushi somewhere else.  Sacrificing the quality of the ingredients just isnt worth the low price.
I LOVE THIS PLACE!!! It is SO good and definitely has the best buffet around, and I typically don't care for buffets.

The lighting is way too bright and our waitress wasn't amazing.  The Cowboy Maki roll is delicious, i suggest pairing it with ponzu sauce.  The steak roll is not good at all.  I love that they have mochi too.

Ru San's has been on my "must try" list for ages, but having a husband that doesn't eat sushi doesn't bode well for me sometimes. Thankfully, our friends decided to have their birthday dinner there, so my husband was forced to buck it up and take one for the team and I'm so glad he did!  The sushi was a fresh, unique, and delicious as I've been told. We had several rolls for the table to share and each one was better than the last. My husband had a noodle dish and was very pleased as well.  We had a few specialty cocktails, too. We loved it all, from beginning to end!

I've been here several times when I'm charlotte it's basically the only place I eat sushi when I come here. The customer service is so on point, and the food is AMAZING. get here early if you go on the weekends because there's always a wait.

The pro's - $1 rolls actually do not taste as bad as $1 rolls should
I love the parking lot (unlike KO). Mui Buena roll. Cheap. 

The con's- A lot of fried stuff...not a ton of simple elegant rolls. The quality of the fish- well couldn't really taste that over all of the fried stuff. Not everyone wants sriracha on everything. Do not try the plum wine- yuck. The rolls seemed a bit sloppy. I think they would do much better if they scaled back and took their time when making a roll. They need to figure out tastes and flavors that work nicely together and then they would be set. 



Mui Buena - best
Calif roll- pretty standard
Shrimp Ceviche roll- eh just ok  
Spricy Tuna- nothing special
Gone with the Wind- a bit ridiculous in my opinion...not a ton of flavor here although interesting concept. It absolutely is a "whirlwind" as the menu describes it
Crunchy Tuna- most fish in the sushi but it wasnt spectacular by any means. This was the only roll left unfinished. 
American Flag Roll- didnt try but it heard it was bad...swimming in a weird sauce that covered every inch (literally) of the plate...just odd. 

I would go back and give it another try - but it's definitely not my favorite...

I've only been for the sushi lunch buffet, but it's such a steal. Unlimited sushi and a few hot dishes for around $12, and the quality of the sushi isn't too bad. We try to get a group together once a lunch to enjoy it.

so i used to go to ru sans way back in the day for their lunch buffet, this was before they expanded.  i always liked it just fine, good/decent food for a good price but it faded in my brain and i forgot about it.  then i went there again wednesday night.  half price bottle of good wine, couple rolls, couple pieces of sashimi and am back on the runsans train.  not only have they made the resty twice as big since i was there last it still has an upbeat atmosphere and extremely reasonable prices, actually id almost call it cheap.  so i summation, rusans is the best value for sushi in the city and how can you go wrong with half price bottles of wine?  i'll be back there a lot

Ru San's is definitely on heavy rotation for dinner.  It's not the best sushi, but it's good and it's cheap!  I call it Everyday Sushi.  

It's also one of the ony places that serves decent skewers.  Definitely try to the tempura enoki and salmon skin.  The siracha sauce on the table stops me from having to bother the waiter for it!

I've been to Rusans sooo many times for dinner but haven't been for the buffet.  

Being off work on Labor Day we decided to check it out. The buffet starts at 11:30.  My recommendation is to get there right when it starts.  There were tons of options from regular rolls, fried rolls, teriyaki chicken, soup, salad, dessert, etc.  I tried to take some pictures but it was so crowded that I couldn't get good ones!   The whole restaurant was filled without an empty seat in the place.

The service was incredible and the lines went fast for sushi and all of the extras.  When a dish ran out, it was replaced immediately.  

The best part of it all..... the price!!  $11.99

Everyone has been telling me for weeks that since we now live in SouthEnd, we need to walk down to Ru San's.  We did... and likely won't very often.

We strongly prefer the normal size sushi and aren't fans of paying for a more expensive roll only to find out that it has more rice than the other rolls.  If a piece of sushi takes more than a bite, I'm not as big on it.  I like a roll to encapsulate all the flavors, not to get a little of this and a little of that in two bites.  That being said, wasn't a fan of the 'Dancing Eel'.  

Service was definitely sub par and the place is crazy noisy.  We plan to go back another time and will try the outdoor seating.  Also, the protein bomb looks great as it's hard to screw up nagiri.  The Cowboy was okay and the dumplngs were average dumplings.  

With better service, extract the noise, and ordering different things, there is still a chance for good food here.  I'm a firm believer in 2nd and 3rd chances.  Check out the photos for what we ate!

Ru San's has to be one of the most-reviewed places in Charlotte (not that really tells you much), and I'm not a big eater of sushi, so I probably won't be adding a lot here.

The restaurant itself is tucked into a nondescript strip mall off Park Road - and not likely the Park Road that you're likely to have seen towards the South side of Charlotte, but up near the center city instead.

If you happen to find it, you might be surprised by how large it is once you're inside, and apparently the menu is pretty good-sized as well.  I've actually never looked at it, as I've only been once, and that was for their lunch when I met friends there.

The lunch is a decently-priced $10 for all-you-care-to-eat sushi, but not being an expert on the cuisine, I can't say if it's particular good.  I actually ate a decent sampling of what was on the buffet, meaning it probably isn't that great.  I didn't really care for most of it, just because it didn't seem that fresh or tasty, and the fact that I took it at all means to me that it doesn't seem that great.  Take that to mean what you will!

During lunch there is also a small Chinese section to the buffet where you can get fairly standard Chinese fare too, but again, it's not that great.

Also, be warned that the place is simply packed.  Go early or late!
This place is great for inexpensive and tasty sushi, but the menu is huge. If you liked what you ordered then make sure to remember the name, otherwise u might have a miss during your next meal.

Had a much better experience here. I could not believe we got sat right away. We came at a good time for dinner (6pm) and by the time we were done, the place was packed. Sushi was great. The only thing I don't like about this place is that they change the menu a lot! Half price wine bottles on wednesdays are always a plus.

Ru Sans is known for its sushi buffet. It has a great selection of rolls and some other Asian selections on the hot bar. The sushi quality isn't the highest but it is delicious. Service has always been good and fast.
Always fresh very kid friendly sushi buffet is awesome deal for families, my go to place.
Great Food and even better prices... though the service can be slow

Best sushi I've had in years. Fresh, tons of choices, reasonably priced. We had two rolls, calamari and a side of shrimp tempura for $30 minus tip. Service was prompt and pleasant. Our waitress gave me the check which was funny; took it as a sign it's my turn to buy dinner so I did. The two rolls we had were beauts. Next time, we're getting three rolls and no app. No wait at dinner time. Perfect way to start 2015!
Terrible service. The Website is out of date and they do not offer the services that at plainly displayed on the website. Recommend Zen Fusion which has much better service and food.,

So many options! Like it or not, I think that's a good thing for sushi spots. We have someone with a shellfish allergy so it's nice to have something other than plain salmon or tuna rolls. Came in late on a weeknight so can't speak to the wait time here, but the service was satisfactory and we got what we came for. Good tasty and semi creative sushi. The prices aren't bad but can get pricey if you have a huge appetite. Otherwise come on the days they have the lunch buffet!

Came here because I thought that it would be similar to the ones in Atlanta.

The menu is the same; the service, however, is a lot different.

They are slow....as hell. As I'm sitting here with my stomach literally touching my spine (we've been sitting, at this point, for over 34 minutes waiting for our order), I'm starting to wonder if someone had to fly to Japan to get some fish out of their water to serve us in Charlotte.


Definitely don't come here if you're about to die from hunger because well, you just might.

PS: the bald guy (I'm assuming is the owner) literally forces a smile. Anyone who can't speak to a baby when a baby speaks is an assh*le off rip.

PS2: our waiter was nice and super cute. I want to put emphasis on this because he is not responsible for the kitchen's goings on and will be tipped accordingly.

I heard a lot of good things about this place so I decided to go try to lunch sushi buffet because I've never been to one just for sushi lol. Overall the sushi was okay, pretty good not for anyone who is really picky about their sushi (I've worked at a Japanese resturant & my boyfriend is a Japanese chef). I would come back if I lived around there but I live pretty far lol. At first I was confused because of labels and what not. I really liked the service. The guy even though it was a very busy refilled our drinks very quickly! But for those who want to come try it I would give one heads up. 1.) Go close to the time they open for lunch because we went around 11 before it opened and there was already a line!
Was good but I didn't like what I ordered was completely my fault but I will definitely be back if I'm in the Charlotte area again.
Love this place! Great sushi! Their dinner sushi is way better than their lunch sushi, but that's because they do an all you can easy sushi buffet for lunch. They also have a very fun atmosphere!

Went for the weekend lunch sushi buffet. It was $13 plus tax and tip, which is not a bad deal. Got maybe a dozen varieties of sushi and rolls, plus some other items like fried chicken wings, seared salmon and miso soup on the buffet line. The sushi is certainly better than the sushi you'll get at the usual Asian buffets.

First time at Ru San's... so so good! Enjoyed Angry Spider (meh), Cowboy Maki (so good with the mango salsa!), Dancing Eel (orgasm in my mouth), Mad Max (cucumber- licious!), Tootsie (so so good), and candy crush roll with strawberry sauce!!! Amazing service by Pamela aka D!!! Will definitely be back for more innovative sushi!

COOL spot if your looking for some great sushi after hours! I have spent plenty of nights here sobering up. Somewhere between the hours of 10 and 12 O'clock at night. I have also spent more money here than I have at the bars (haha). 

Obviously, my favorite thing about Ru San's is that they stay open pretty late on most nights. It is one thing to find a place open during these hours, but even more difficult to find SUSHI at this time! They have really saved me from settling for Harris Teeter's two day old sushi. 

In my opinion, their sushi is absolutely fantastic! It is probably some of the best sushi I have ever had. It is one of those sushi restaurants where you can enjoy the raw stuff, because you KNOW that the fish is fresh. Far too many times have I eaten at a lower quality joint, where I couldn't order raw fish because it wasn't fresh.

It is not just the food that is great, but the service is always on point. There has not been a time yet that I have had an empty cup. This is important to me, as I tend to go through at least a gallon of water when I go out to eat (especially after drinking). The creativity that is put into every dish is very unique. This brings me to the downside as it can get very pricey. Also, make sure if your ordering from the "special roll" menu, to ask if it is actually a sushi roll or an entree. I have ordered a roll from this menu once, and when my food came out It was definitely not sushi. It was just a regular entree with some rice..I was very confused. 

I highly recommend this place If you are looking for sushi any time of the day/night. I think you will enjoy your visit as I always do. Two thumbs up for high quality fish!

I really wanted to like this place because my brother was raving about it. We stopped by on a early Friday night and it was already busy. Luckily we didn't have to wait for a table and were seated in a booth close to the entrance. Our server was very nice and friendly, but was a bit slow after we placed our orders and it took her a while to get our check and give it back.

The menu is ridiculously big and when I tried to look it up online it was no where to be found, likely because it would crash the computer trying to download it. We started with the tempura appetizer - the batter wasn't crunchy and onion wasn't included, which I found odd since it's a staple tempura veggie. We each had a spicy tuna hand roll. It had lots of big pieces of tuna but the seaweed wrap wasn't crunchy either. Then we had the hamachi sashimi - the pieces were big and too thick (one of my pet peeves for sashimi). We also split a Monsters Inc roll which was good - soft shell crab with spicy tuna and unagi. Perhaps it's best to stick with rolls here.

This has been on my list for quite sometime and it finally worked out that I was in the area for lunch. Didn't quite see anything on the buffet I wanted so I ordered from the menu. I got 3 Maki rolls and 2 yakitori  skewers. The sushi was very fresh and the spicy tuna roll was unique. Instead of the typical spicy mayo it had a some what bbq sauce with a nice heat to it. Different but not bad in any way. The bacon wrapped scallop yakitori is damn good. Will most definitely come back in the future.
This place is amazeballs! Great quality sushi using some unconventional ingredients in some very interesting ways. Just my kind of place.

This used to be one of my and most of my friends go-to places but they recently updated the menu inexplicably removing most of the items that made it unique and worth going out of the way for.  They used to have several non-seafood sushi roll options including the Spicy Chicken sushi roll and the Ginger Simmered Beef Maki roll.  Now they have nothing except various cheese sushi rolls.  I understand needing to raise the prices but that made no sense.

I was told before the Spicy Chicken sushi roll was discontinued that they might be able to still make it even though it wasn't officially on the menu.  Tonight I found out that's not the case even though they still have the Spicy Tuna roll.  

It's still alright but not different than any other sushi place in Charlotte.

Ru San's is a lot of fun -and noisy!    Be prepared to be greeted by a lot of yelling when you walk in the door - and again when you leave!  The lunch buffet hosts a fairly standard sushi line-up and is a great place for a quick, tasty lunch during the week.  For dinner, the rolls are way more creative - try the punk rock and roll (my favorite!) and the Jana Moon.  I have found ordering the chirashi at a sushi restaurant gives you a good idea of the quality of the fish, and I have to say the quality here is not the greatest.  Stick to the rolls and shy away from any sashimi other than tuna and salmon.  Would be a great restaurant to bring out of town guests to!

Ru San's was hubby and I's favorite sushi spot in town for a long time (until Cowfish ousted the Ru).  Great, fresh, and you can find a lot of unusual stuff on the menu.  Tons of food for a great value.  We like to order weird stuff (I find it's easier to eat something unfamiliar if you aren't exactly sure what it is), so their big plate thingies (forget what they are called) are great for that.  Just a bunch of delicious weird stuff piled onto a huge plate.  Done.  Love the atmosphere here, too - everyone is very friendly and upbeat.  Delicious rolls too!  Final verdict:  one of the better places around to get sushi for a reasonable price.  Plus weird stuff!

GOOD all you can eat lunch buffett for $13????  I was skeptical, to say the least, but happy with the products offered.  But most impressed with customer service, as everyone we saw on way out thanked us for coming...too many places fail in this dept.  Well done Ru Sans and I will be back MANY more times
I eat here anytime I am in the area.  Love it.  The Firecracker roll is awe.some.

Great Sushi, always fresh and friendly.  Can get very packed on weekends.  Great rolls and dollar sushi.  Great place to take sushi lovers and sushi novices as there is so much to choose from.  The sushi chef Sam is my favorite.

We love eating the sushi lunch. Can't beat that deal and the fish is good. They are putting it out quick so it is not sitting around. I don't like buffets for that reason and I don't mind it there. I do wish they would change the type of rolls more often. Always the same ones.

I'm rarely in the mood for sushi, but the BF is so we stop by here every few months. With that said, on my very first visit, I was very pleased to see that they had a little section of vegetarian rolls for $2.95 each. My favorites are the spinach, kimchi, & tempura cream cheese rolls. Ru San's surprisingly has some of the best kimchi I have tasted, besides my mom's of course. It's even better than all of the Korean restaurants I've tried (I haven't tried many.. maybe 5 within the last 3 years?). The kimchi is very sour, just the way it should be!

When I don't want sushi, I just get some steamed veggie dumplings.. yum! I think each order comes with 8 but that's not enough for me so 2 orders it is! The veggie udon noodles are pretty good, but can be very oily. Agedashi tofu is ok.. it's just soft tofu in a tempura batter.. I hate soft tofu.. Also tried the mushroom yakitori.. good 'shrooms, but the sauce is sooo sweet! Blech. The fried ice cream is very good, although I don't like the artificial strawberry sauce they sometimes use to decorate it.

Service can be pretty erratic.. definitely hit or miss, which is why I knocked off a star. I also don't like that sodas are served in cans.. seriously just invest in a soda fountain. Very loud environment, great place for a group of people to hang out but not somewhere I would like to go to regularly.

This place is awesome! Go here for the lunch buffet it is amazing! Sushi is very fresh and they have really different roles. Prices are very reasonable I could eat here every week! Never been disappointed here.

42 piece sashimi sampler - This is a boat load of sashimi.. literally a huge boat. I would recommend against it even though it's a good deal because it includes alot of sashimi that most people are afraid of eating (e.g. Uni - looks like poo, Octopus - has tentacles, Shrimp heads - self-explanatory...)

Snow White Roll - YUM

Sushi Tart - butter on top of sushi? Excellent idea. Hard to share, but delicious.

Steak Roll (special) - Good for the unadventurous. 

Kobe Steak Appetizer - Good steak, the sauce was a little too sweet for me.

Salmon Sashimi, Rich and Famous, Yellow Tail - Always a winner

Tuna Poke, Tuna Sashimi - Always kinda... meh.

3 egg sushi - WHOA, too overwhelming. Could only eat 1.

And they also have half off bottles of wine during Happy Hour!
Great sushi Great atmosphere the wait is worth it Big going to this place for over 15 years consistently great Sushi

Came here for my boyfriend's son's birthday.  He wanted sushi so sushi he got.  This happens to be my guys favorite sushi place so we try to come when we're in Charlotte.  

Pricing is a bit high but they have an extensive menu from sashimi to rolls and bento boxes. 

They also have noodles and fried rice as well as dessert.  

We spent about  $160 for two adults and 2 kids.  A couple of sake and beer. 

Place does get busy on the weekends so if you plan on trying it out, go early or off hours if you don't want to wait in line.

This is a favorite of mine when visiting Charlotte.  The sushi is good (even if not great) and the prices are great as well.  The grinch roll, rich & famous roll, and kiss of fire are our favorites.  Even if something is no longer on the menu, they will still make it for you!
#PokeBowl was excellent but was disappointed with a one (1) little scoop of #greenteaicecream ? What's that about? I'm a regular so I noticed right away. Kind of ruined #thefeelz
